data.title: OSX: Empty atom.icns leads to crash when publishing game
data.body:
Unable to publish games using the one-click Publish project button located in the top-left corner.
Application exit, then system alert raised: "Superpowers quit unexpectedly." 
OSX 10.11.2

data.title: Cut-Copy-Paste key bindings not working on Mac OSX
data.body:
Following http://docs.superpowers-html5.com/en/getting-started/first-game

The editor does not support Command-X,C,V consistently.

Right-click menu does work.

data.title: Linux 32 bits
data.body: Support 32-bits linux?

data.title: Allow system plugins to provide publishing options
data.body:
When clicking the `Publish project` button (http://docs.superpowers-html5.com/en/getting-started/publishing-your-game), rather than always downloading a ZIP archive of your exported game, a system and/or maybe one of its plugins should be able define different options.

Some use cases:
- Push a static website on GitHub Pages with Superpowers Web
- Upload a game or an update directly to itch.io with Superpowers Game or LÃ–VE
- Install or update a Minecraft resource pack and launch Minecraft with it
- etc.

data.title: client: Hide login form until `superpowers.json` has been loaded
data.body:
We should have a "Connecting..." indicator while everything is being fetched. This will prevent having the password field appear randomly while the user is typing their username, especially on slow connections to a remote server.

The relevant folder is [client/src/login](https://github.com/superpowers/superpowers/tree/master/client/src/login.)

If you want to help but need guidance, feel free to ask! http://docs.superpowers-html5.com/en/development/how-to-contribute

data.title: [DOCS] Mention that you cannot use setLocalPosition or setPosition if there is an ArcadeBody2D.Body attached to the Actor
data.body:
I didn't find the docs source code, so I figured I would just create an issue here.
I think you should mention that when an `ArcadeBody2D.Body` is attached to an Actor you cannot use `setPosition` or `setLocalPosition` on this Actor. Of course it makes sense, but I just spent half an hour debugging my code and it wasn't obvious at all :P 
I know you are all really busy, so if the docs are available just tell me where they are and I will make the modification myself :+1:

data.title: server: Use mkdirp to create user data folder, fixes #17
data.body: Creating the pull request for @Valdaria ^_^

data.title: Replace `<Type>x` with `x as Type` (fixes #21)
data.body: I wrote a script who replace every "<type>expression" by "(expression as type)" (#21). It seems to work.

data.title: Create a thread in html5gamedevs?
data.body:
I understand you have a forum, at html5gamedevs, there are largest community members you should be made SuperPowers a presence there and most of us already have user accounts. Hope to see you there!

http://www.html5gamedevs.com/

data.title: Support superpowers:// protocol to invite people to a server
data.body:
That would make it very easy to join a server through the app.

[From Gitter](https://gitter.im/superpowers/dev?at=56929e4b8fdd3c0c382dcf48):

> We could use Electron to register a custom protocol: https://github.com/atom/electron/blob/master/docs/api/protocol.md
> and then links like superpowers://1.2.3.4:4237/ could work?
> with a redirect service so that it links in most chats: something like http://server.superpowers-html5.com/1.2.3.4/4237 that redirect to superpowers://1.2.3.4:4237/

And if the superpowers:// doesn't open the app, the page could still offer to connect directly through the browser. Best of both worlds!

data.title: Rename `systems/supGame` to `systems/game` and migrate projects
data.body:
To be consistent, we should use the part after `superpowers-` in the repository name as the system folder name. Same for `markSlide` (should be `markslide`) and `supWeb` (should be `web`).
- [x] Automate the 3 folder renames by checking if they exist with `fs.statSync` (ensure `.isDir` is true) and do a `fs.renameSync` call in https://github.com/superpowers/superpowers/blob/master/scripts/build.js
- [x] Bump `currentFormatVersion` to 4 and update `pub.system` if `oldFormatVersion <= 3` in https://github.com/superpowers/superpowers/blob/master/SupCore/Data/ProjectManifest.ts

data.title: Add Travis CI
data.body:
## Integrate your GitHub project with Travis-ci
- First go to https://travis-ci.org/ and sign in with your GitHub account.
- In the upper right corner click on your name (or choose `Accounts`) to open your Travis-ci profile.  
  You'll be presented with the list of your GitHub projects (only the ones where you have administrative authority)
- Toggle the switch on one of your projects and then click on little wrench icon to open the project's `Service Hooks` page on GitHub.
  To get to the same place from your GitHub project, go to `Settings` > `Service Hooks`. 
- On the `Service Hooks` page scroll down to Travis and you'll notice that the hook is already activated. Click on "Travis".
- Click on `Test Hook`.

data.title: server: Use mkdirp to create user data folder, fixes #17
data.body: Fixing bug which doesn't create the ~/.local/share folder if doesn't exist

data.title: Server closes silently after ~10 minutes when running in Electron 64-bit launcher
data.body:
This seems to be an [Electron](https://github.com/atom/electron) bug. Updating to 0.36 might just fix it. Otherwise we'll have to dig deeper.

**Workaround for now:** Use the 32-bit of Superpowers, with Electron 32-bit!

data.title: Error creating directory on initial launch?
data.body:
Just ran into this problem on Fedora/CentOS. Workaround is to create the directory manually. Something wrong with the mkdir code not creating the directory if it doesn't already exist?

Using data from /root/.local/share/Superpowers.
/root/superpowers-0.18.1-linux-x64/resources/app/server/paths.js:47
        throw err;
        ^

Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, mkdir '/root/.local/share/Superpowers'
    at Error (native)
    at Object.fs.mkdirSync (fs.js:794:18)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/root/superpowers-0.18.1-linux-x64/resources/app/server/paths.js:43:8)
    at Module._compile (module.js:435:26)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:442:10)
    at Module.load (module.js:356:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:313:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:366:17)
    at require (module.js:385:17)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/root/superpowers-0.18.1-linux-x64/resources/app/server/index.js:8:13)

data.title: Make project migration safer
data.body: We should load/migrate one project at a time so that if one crashes, others aren't affected

data.title: Replace all usage of `<Type>expression` with `expression as Type`
data.body:
The `as` operator is more readable and it's the recommended operator going forward because of clashes with JSX syntax.

Like #14, this is an easy but somewhat menial task that might take a while so feel free to do a couple files at a time if you want to get started contributing!

See Microsoft/TypeScript#3564 and https://facebook.github.io/react/docs/jsx-in-depth.html

data.title: Allow opening documentation for the current editor or tool with F1
russian locale
data.body: add russian locale

data.title: Allow to browserify plugins folders who don't have an "index.ts" file.
Create user data folder if it doesn't exist
data.body:
For instance, on Unix, `~/.local/share` might not exist.

Basically, the change amounts to importing `mkdirp` and replacing the call to `fs.mkdirSync` here: https://github.com/superpowers/superpowers/blob/5aa494a71e63cf465253390f68a3166b99c32921/server/paths.ts#L41 with `mkdirp.sync`.

data.title: Externalize plugins from systems
data.body:
Hi ! First, congrats for the open-sourcing ! That's an awesome project :)

I have a question regarding plugins and package management :
Currently the plugins used by a system are stored (and versioned) in the `plugins/` directory under different namespaces. Some plugins are used in different systems (`common`) and are fetched using git submodules.

As every plugin has a `package.json` in superpowers, why not just using npm to resolve plugins dependencies ? (and, potentially, to use systems as superpowers dependencies ?)

This may bring many benefits: maintainability, installing and updating plugins from cli/ui, nested dependencies...

I made [some quick tests](https://github.com/risq/superpowers/commit/8f41df58d71542630f04c3b3c2a3c151e108628d) if you are interested. This is just a proof of concept (a quick hack on the system loader).

If you want to test it, just clone the repo (`git@github.com:risq/superpowers.git`), checkout on `externalized-plugins`, clone the official `superpowers-game` into `./systems`. 

Then manually delete `plugins/default/font` and build superpowers. Add the external font plugin (https://github.com/risq/superpowers-game-sparklinlabs-font-plugin) dependency with `npm i risq/superpowers-game-sparklinlabs-font-plugin --save`. Run the server, you should see the fonts plugin properly loaded.

Tell me what you think about this, and thanks for your great work !

data.title: Use `const` whenever possible
data.body:
We've been using `let` for declaring variables almost everywhere. This is a good thing, as it is better-behaved than `var` (yay for block-scoping!).

But ES6 / TypeScript actually comes with [`const` keyword](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Statements/const). As a general rule, we should use it whenever possible, that is, whenever the variable identifier isn't meant to be reassigned.

**Rationale:** It will make variable identifiers that are meant to be reassigned easier to locate, and will reduce the likelihood of accidental reassignements.

> The const declaration creates a read-only reference to a value. It does not mean the value it holds is immutable, just that the variable identifier cannot be reassigned.

Doing this in the whole codebase all at once might be a pain, so feel free to submit a pull request that just takes care of a file or two. Over time, we'll get there.

data.title: [OSX] Error: ENOTDIR: not a directory... .DS_Store
data.body:
Whenever i'm trying to start the server, it crashes immediately, trying to locate the templates.json file in .DS_Store before looking into the supGame folder. You can start the server if you remove the file, but you'll have to do it every time you want to start it.

App threw an error when running { [Error: ENOTDIR: not a directory, open '../superpowers-master/systems/.DS_Store/public/templates.json']
  errno: -20,
  code: 'ENOTDIR',
  syscall: 'open',
  path: '../superpowers-master/systems/.DS_Store/public/templates.json' }
